title: 1994 GMC TopKick Cat Diesel Flatbed Truck
item_description:
1994 GMC TopKick Cat Diesel Flatbed Truck

Removal Note: This lot can only be removed on Monday, November 25th, 2024, from 9:00 AM to 3:30 PM. Earlier or later times will not be permitted.

Specifications

  • Year: 1994
  • Make: GMC
  • License: 4Y32236
  • VIN: 1GDM7H1J5RJ513413 
    • Registration Expiration: NA 
    • VIN RECORD NOT ON FILE. 
  • Odometer Reads: 113,189
  • Key: Not Available
  • GVWR: 33,000
  • Drive Type: Rear Wheel Drive
  • Body Style: Utility Truck
  • Fuel Type: Diesel
  • Transmission: Manual
  • Tire Size: 10.00-20 Load Range G
  • Deck Length: 201”
  • Deck Width: 96”

Exterior

  • Exterior Color: White
  • Doors: Four Door

Interior

  • Interior Material: Vinyl
  • Interior Color: Blue
  • Features:
    • Air Conditioning
    • Dual Rear Wheels
  • Needs (2) batteries to start, West Auctions used (1) but it was bad

Note: VIN RECORD NOT ON FILE with California DMV. Seller purchased this vehicle on March 13, 2001 with Bill of Sale. Buyer will receive the following; previous Bill of Sale paperwork when seller purchased truck, Application for Replacement Title, Transfer Form, Death Certificate, and Transfer without Probate will be mailed 2-3 weeks after removal. Thank you for your patience. The Bidder shall not bid on behalf of another individual; the Bidder/Purchaser/DMV Registrant must be the same. The Buyer is fully responsible for all aspects of inspections, re-registration, transfer, taxes, and fees due to the DMV.

CARB Truck and Bus Regulation Statement: “An on-road heavy-duty diesel or alternative-diesel vehicle operated in California may be subject to the California Air Resources Board Regulation to Reduce Particulate Matter and Criteria Pollutant Emissions from In-Use Heavy-Duty Diesel Vehicles. It, therefore, could be subject to exhaust retrofit or accelerated turnover requirements to reduce emissions of air pollutants.” For more information, please visit the California Air Resources Board website at http://www.arb.ca.gov/dieseltruck.” This vehicle may be reported as a Non-Compliant Vehicle, and you may not be able to register in California without meeting the CARB Truck and Bus Regulations. It is the buyer's responsibility to read and understand the ARB Multi-Regulation Summary Requirements for Diesel Truck Owners. Beginning January 1, 2020, the Department of Motor Vehicles (DMV) CANNOT register any vehicle that does not meet the requirements of the Truck and Bus Regulation.
